alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Logan; Noble; Payne (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 7:21AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Lincoln, southeastern Noble, eastern Logan and Payne Counties through 800 AM CDT... At 720 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles west of Pawnee to 3 miles northeast of Stillwater to 6 miles south of Lake Carl Blackwell. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Stillwater, Cushing, Perkins, Langston, Yale, Wellston, Morrison, Carney, Glencoe, Tryon, Ripley, Agra, Coyle, Warwick, Fallis, Lake Carl Blackwell, Lake Mcmurtry, Quay, Avery and Ingalls. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 168 and 172. Interstate 44 between mile markers 154 and 159. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
